main.description: I know how to get $#!+ done.

about.bio: After 5 years of diverse technical experience ranging from quality assurance to project management consulting, I'm pursuing web development because it is something I've always wanted to do. I discovered my real passion for the front-end after completing a full stack coding boot camp last year. Outside of that, I manage the day-to-day operations for a non-profit that provides free web design for small businesses in underserved communities. In the rest of my free time, you can find me camping, hiking, mountain biking, practicing yoga, writing, reading, tending to my houseplants, or traveling.

timeline.title: Education
timeline.description: I graduated from Penn State University with a degree in Biomedical Engineering.

timeline.title: Professional Experience
timeline.description: I work for a leading healthcare technology company, starting out testing the software, transitioning to project management for software implementations, as well as technical support, & consulting.

timeline.title: Web Development
timeline.description: I had been interested in programming for many years. I finally decided to complete a Full Stack Web Development Boot Camp and realized my passion for front-end development. I am working on a new website for my current company and continuing to expand my development knowledge daily.

timeline.title: Web Design & Technical Management
timeline.description: I volunteer my time as the Vice President & Technical Lead for The Underdog Foundation, designing websites and coordinating technical efforts to help small, local businesses impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic that need a little extra support.

projects.title: HelpersConnect
projects.description: A MERN-stack app that allows charitable organizations to manage events and volunteers via the Google Calendar API.

projects.title: Code Connect
projects.description: A full-stack (CRUD) social platform for developers to connect to meet, collaborate, and learn.

projects.title: Bob Ross's Portfolio Template
projects.description: Here is what it would look like if Bob Ross had a modern, mobile-responsive portfolio.

projects.title: Date Nite
projects.description: A one-click solution to planning dates utilizing server-side APIs.

projects.title: Read-Da-Book
projects.description: An application to manage a reading list of books on a SQL database rendered with Handlebars.

projects.title: Weather Dashboard
projects.description: A weather application utilizing server-side APIs and persistent data via local storage.

projects.title: The Underdog Foundation
projects.description: Maintains the website and manages the content for The Underdog Foundation, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that provides business development services to small, local businesses in underserved communities free of charge.

projects.title: Welton Street Cafe
projects.description: Built and maintains the website for the famous & historic Welton Street Cafe in Five Points, Denver.

projects.title: Genna Rae's Wings & More
projects.description: Built a website for Genna Rae's Wings, the best wing shop in Denver, CO.

quotes.text: From the beginning with demonstration, planning, and rollout to go-live support, Darian has been amazing.  I have done many projects and have had some good support and some questionable support, and Darian has went above and beyond to assist us with our questions and needs while giving us knowledgeable answers and realistic solutions.  She is professional and knowledgeable while still being approachable which can be a rare combination.

Since the beginning, Darian has jumped in and has blown away all of our expectations. I received comments from the IT department and our operational leaders on how impressed they are with her. We've really appreciated her eye for detail, her ability to speak up and provide insightful comments to conversations, and her positive attitude. She has built rapport and trust with individuals throughout the organization. We would not have been able to have had a successful implementation without her.

Darian has gone above and beyond. Not only has she gone out of her way to single-handedly redesign, test, and improve existing workflows, her transparency with operational leaders and IT analysts has earned her strong credibility that other [consultants] struggled to achieve [on the project].
